newsitem.title: OMAN: Gulfstream Resources wins Oman oil deal.
newsitem.headline: Gulfstream Resources wins Oman oil deal.

text.p: Oman on Saturday signed a $20 million oil exploration and production agreement with Canada's Gulfstream Resources Canada Ltd, the Ministry of Petroleum and Minerals said.
"The Canadian company has been awarded exploration and production rights in Hofar region number 30 in the north of the Sultanate (of Oman)," the statement said.
It said the agreement commits the Canadian company to spend at least $20 million over the next six years on exploration programmes, which include drilling three exploratory wells.

Oman's Minister of Petroleum and Mineral Resources Said bin Ahmed al-Shanfari said the agreement with the Canadian company was one of many his ministry plans to sign for oil exploration in various parts of the country.
Oman produces 900,000 barrels per day of oil -- which accounts for nearly three-quarters of government revenue.
